meanings.definition: Formed or arranged in a network or plexus.
meanings.sent1: The plexiform pattern of the leaves made them look like a beautiful net.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a plexiform design using intricate lines and shapes.
meanings.sent3: The plexiform clouds in the sky seemed to be playing a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were plexiform, connecting ideas in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The plexiform structure of the building was both elegant and functional.

meanings.sent1: The plexiform growth on the tree branches looked like tiny interconnected knots.
meanings.sent2: The fabric had a plexiform texture that felt smooth yet complex.
meanings.sent3: The plexiform shadows on the ground seemed to dance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a plexiform maze, full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The plexiform roots of the tree spread out like a hidden web underground.
